description: Variation of condition 2 pursuant to planning permission dated 12/07/1984 ref 84/S/1313 (Use of ground floor shop for the sale of hot 'take-away' food) to allow the hours of operation between 11am to 1am Monday to Thursday and 11am to 2am Friday to Sunday.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed extension of opening hours would likely result in neighbouring occupiers experiencing a greater degree of disturbance for a longer period during a time when they could expect reasonable peace and quiet. The extended opening hours would therefore be significantly detrimental to the living conditions of neighbouring residential occupiers. Therefore, the proposal is contrary to the NPPF (2021), policy D14 of the London Plan, policy DMS1 of the DMPD (2016) and policy IS4 of the Core Strategy (2016). It would also be contrary to emerging policy LP2 of Wandsworth's Publication Version Local Plan (2022).

Reason : 2 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre application advice service. However, we have been unable to seek solutions to problems as the principle of the proposal is clearly contrary to our statutory policies and negotiation could not overcome the reasons for refusal.
